title: The bodies of two children are found at a home as police investigate 'suspicious circumstances'
text:
The bodies of two children have been found inside a home while a mother is under police guard with self-inflicted wounds.

After police were alerted at 6pm on Friday, officers rushed to a home in Madeley, in northern Perth, and discovered the bodies of children aged six and 10 years old.

The circumstances leading to the deaths of the two children is not yet known.

After police were alerted at 6pm on Friday, officers rushed to a home in Madeley, in northern Perth, and discovered the bodies of children aged six and 10 years old

A woman, believed to be their mother, was found injured in nearby sand dunes at Kallaroo at arrested by police at 8:40pm on Friday.

'It appears she has self inflicted wounds that are non life threatening however she is receiving medical treatment and as a result is unable to be interviewed at this point in time,' police told reporters.

The deaths are currently being treated as suspicious and detectives will be going over the home for the next few weeks.

Police told reporters that the two children were both girls and a woman understood to be their mother was found with self inflicted wounds nearby

'This is a tragic event and our heartfelt condolences go out to the friends and family of the children,' police said.

'Heart breaking events like this have an effect not only on those directly involved, the friends and family, but on the wider community of Western Australia.

'I can assure the people of Western Australia that the WA Police are doing all that they can to investigate this manner and to try and identify what it is that led to these tragic events,' they said.

A person is understood to be assisting police with their inquiries.

The WA Police have asked anyone with information to please contact Crime Stoppers on 1800 333 000.

More to come.
description: The bodies of two children have been found inside a Perth home while a mother is under police guard with self inflicted wounds.
authors: Tom Place For Daily Mail Australia
